alert.note: Alert for Adair; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 11 at 10:49PM CST until January 11 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CST FOR WESTERN BENTON...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND NORTHEASTERN ADAIR COUNTIES... At 1049 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of West Siloam Springs to 4 miles northwest of Westville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Decatur... Westville... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Highfill... Watts... Springtown... Northwest Arkansas Regional Air... Cincinnati... Maysville... Elm Springs... Lake Eucha State Park... Savoy... Ballard... This includes Interstate 49 near mile marker 65. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tulsa.
